goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (PDF 221 KB)
target: 10.1 By 2030, progressively achieve and sustain income growth of the bottom 40 per cent of the population at a rate higher than the national average
title: Untitled
indicator_name: Consumption expenditures growth rate of the bottom 40% of the population
national_indicator_available: 10.1.1.b. Consumption expenditures growth rate of the bottom 40% of the population
computation_calculations:
The average growth rate of consumption expenditures per person – represents the evolution over time of consumption expenditures of bottom 40% of the population for a period of 5 years. To calculate it, two values of the same indicator are used, registered in different time units.
To calculate the indicator:
1. the average consumption expenditures are estimated per 1 person out of the bottom 40% of the population for the years T0 and T1;
2. afterwards the annual average growth rate is calculated for the consumption expenditures in between these years according to the formula [[(average in T1) / (average in T0) ^ (1 / (T1-T0))] - 1] * 100.
bottom 40% of the population represent the population from quintiles I-IV with the lowers expenditures.
graph_title: 10.1.1.b. Consumption expenditures growth rate of the bottom 40% of the population
source_responsible_monitoring_1: Ministry of Health, Labour and Social Protection
comparison_global: The global indicator is estimated using the expenditures in USD PPP 2011, and for the national indicator PPP is not used (expenditures in MDL)
